    • Method Detail

      • tryMove

        public boolean tryMove(java.lang.String curr,
                       java.lang.String next)
        returns an integer corresponding to the pieces color when created
        Parameters:
        curr - current coordinates of piece
        next - coordinates for destination
        Returns:
        false because it will always be called with a cast to a subclass

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        returns an integer corresponding to the pieces color when created
        Returns:
        0 for white pieces and 1 for black pieces

      • getRow

        public int getRow()
        returns an integer corresponding to the row of the gamePiece
        Returns:
        value between 0 and 7 for row index

      • getCol

        public int getCol()
        returns an integer corresponding to the column of the gamePiece
        Returns:
        value between 0 and 7 for column index

      • isOneSpace

        public boolean isOneSpace(java.lang.String curr,
                          java.lang.String next)
        returns true if trying to move exactly 1 space away move length restriction for pawns and kings
        Parameters:
        curr - String ID for gamepieces current location
        next - String ID for gamepieces next location
        Returns:
        true or false depending on length of move
        See Also:
        Board.Board(), Board.transRow(char), Board.transCol(char)

      • isValidLoc

        public boolean isValidLoc(java.lang.String curr,
                          java.lang.String next)
        return true if the spot being moved into is not blocked by the same team
        Parameters:
        curr - String ID for gamepieces current location
        next - String ID for gamepieces next location
        Returns:
        true or false depending on openness of new space
        See Also:
        Board.Board(), Board.transRow(char), Board.transCol(char)

      • isPathClear

        public boolean isPathClear(java.lang.String curr,
                           java.lang.String next)
        return true if the path from curr to next is not blocked by other pieces
        Parameters:
        curr - String ID for gamepieces current location
        next - String ID for gamepieces next location
        Returns:
        true or false depending on openness of path
        See Also:
        Board.Board(), Board.transRow(char), Board.transCol(char)

        return true if the path from curr to next moves up the board
        Parameters:

        next - String ID for gamepieces next location
        Returns:
